ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Early Communication Indicator - Description of activity
Early Communication Indicator - Vocalization raw count
Notes: Count of vocalizations - any non-word utterance voiced by the child to a partner (laughing, making animals sounds, sounds that appear to be unintelligible words)

ElementDescription: Early Communication Indicator - Single word raw count
Notes: Count of single-word utterances - a one word intelligible utterance used in isolation (not part of a longer intelligible utterance)

ElementDescription: Early Communication Indicator - Multiple word raw count
Notes: Count of multi-word utterances - any intelligible utterance of two or more words understood by the observer

ElementDescription: Early Communication Indicator - Gesture raw count
Notes: Count of gestures - any physical movement made by the child in an attempt to communicate with the partner (e.g., showing, giving an object or toy, pushing away or rejecting a toy, reaching for a toy, pointing to a person or object, nodding or shaking head to indicate yes or no)

ElementDescription: Early Communication Indicator - Weighted Communication Total
Notes: Sum of 2x single word utterance count, 3x multi-word utterance count, vocalization count, and gesture count (each instance of single word utterances counts as 2, each instance of multiple words counts as 3)
